clinical_study.brief_title: Safe Excipient Exposure in Neonates and Small ChildreN
clinical_study.official_title: Safe Excipient Exposure in Neonates and Small ChildreN - a Retrospective, Descriptive Study Off the Amount of Ethanol, Propylene Glycol, Benzyl Alcohol, Parabens, Acesulfam k, Aspartame, Glycerol, Sorbitol and Polysorbate-80 Exposed to Pediatric Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to explore the quantity of excipient exposure in neonatal and young pediatric patients in a Danish Hospital. The focus will be on the preservatives ethanol, propyl glycol, benzyl alcohol, methyl-p-hydroxybenzoate and propanyl-p-hydroxybenzoate and the artificial sweeteners acesulfam potassium, aspartame, glycerol and sorbitol.

detailed_description.textblock:
Studies have previously examined whether or not neonatal nor pediatric patients are exposed to excipients and what excipients they are possibly exposed to. They have shown that practically all neonatal patients receive one or more drug containing an excipient, known to be harmful. This observational study will look at both registered drugs and extemporaneous pharmaceuticals as possible sources of excipients. Based on information provided by the manufacturer (ex. the index-list), the investigator will calculate the amounts of excipients administered to the patient a week after hospitalisation. The investigator will calculate the blood alcohol content when the neonatal patient are exposed to ethanol and/or propylene glycol.
By grouping the patients according to age and subgrouping according to diagnosis/affected organ system and compare the amount of excipient exposure in each group, the study aims at identifying the most vulnerable neonatal and/or pediatric patients in terms of the amount and identity of excipients accumulated in the patient.
The study will use a descriptive, parametric statistic analysis to identify
- an average exposure rate (concentration i mg/l or amount in mg) of each of the listed excipients
- how much the average patient in each age-group is exposed to each excipient
- how much the average patient in each "affected organ system"-subgroup is exposed to each excipient

primary_outcome.measure: Blood alcohol content measured in per mille (grams of ethanol and propylene glycol pr. kilograms of blood) in the patient
primary_outcome.description: Both concentrations of ethanol and propylene glycol are included in the calculations. with propylene glycol 1/3 as intoxicating as ethanol.

primary_outcome.measure: Concentration (mg/kg/day) of benzyl alcohol in the patient
Concentration (mg/kg/day) of acesulfam potassium in the patient
Concentration (mg/kg/day) of aspartame in the patient
Concentration (mg/kg/day) of glycerin in the patient
Concentration (mg/kg/day) of sorbitol in the patient
Concentration (mg/l) of methyl-p-hydroxybenzoate in the patient
Concentration (mg/kg/day) of propyl-p-hydroxybenzoate in the patient
Concentration (mg/kg/day) of polysorbate-80 in the patient

secondary_outcome.measure: Identification of patient group (according to age-interval) most vulnerable to excipient exposure (measured in number of excipients)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the participants hospitalization, an expected average of 2 months
secondary_outcome.description: The excipients (ethanol, propylene glycol, benzyl alcohol, methyl-p-hydroxybenzoate, propyl-p-hydroxybenzoate, acesulfam potassium, aspartame, glycerol, polysorbate-80 and sorbitol) will be ranked according to which excipient is most often present in the medicine administered to the patients.

secondary_outcome.measure: Identification of patient group (according to age-interval) most vulnerable to excipient exposure (amounts of each excipient measured in (mg/l))
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the participants hospitalization, an expected average of 2 months
secondary_outcome.description: The excipients (ethanol, propylene glycol, benzyl alcohol, methyl-p-hydroxybenzoate, propyl-p-hydroxybenzoate, acesulfam potassium, aspartame, glycerol, polysorbate-80 and sorbitol) will be ranked according to which excipient is most often present in the medicine administered to the patients.

secondary_outcome.measure: Identification of patient group (according to affected organ system) most vulnerable to excipient exposure (measured in number of excipients)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the participants hospitalization, an expected average of 2 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Identification of number of patient exposed to ethanol levels above tolerance levels proposed by international medicines agencies like EMA and FDA
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of each patient daily exposure rate of ethanol to daily tolerance limit

secondary_outcome.measure: Identification of number of patient exposed to propylene glycol levels above tolerance levels proposed by international medicines agencies like EMA and FDA
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of each patient daily exposure rate of proplyene glycol to daily tolerance limit

arm_group.description: Receiving 2 or more drugs at one day during their hospitalisation. For each drug, it is listed whether it is an extemporaneous, registered, the preparation, dosis, amount, interval, formulation and route of administration. It is noted if the drug contains ethanol, propylene glycol, benzyl alcohol, methyl-p-hydroxybenzoate, propanyl-p-hydroxybenzoate, acesulfam potassium, aspartame, glycerin and/or sorbitol.

Receiving 3 or more drugs at one day during their hospitalisation. For each drug, it is listed whether it is an extemporaneous, registered, the preparation, dosis, amount, interval, formulation and route of administration. It is noted if the drug contains ethanol, propylene glycol, benzyl alcohol, methyl-p-hydroxybenzoate, propanyl-p-hydroxybenzoate, acesulfam potassium, aspartame, glycerin and/or sorbitol.

study_pop.textblock:
Neonatal patients and pediatric patients (≤ 5 years) who, at one point, have been/are being treated at the "Neonatalklinikken" (units 5021, 5023, 5024) or "BørneUngeklinikken" (units 5061, 5062, 5054, 4144) of Rigshospitalet, Denmark. To be included in the study, the patients must receive
- 2 or more different drugs if < 28 days old
- 3 or more different drugs if 28 day ≤ 5 years old

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- if < 28 days: must receive 2 or more prescriptions a day
- if 28 days ≤ 5 years: must receive 3 or more prescriptions a day
- must have been/be submitted and treated at the neonatal department (units 5021, 5023, 5024) or pediatric department (units 5061, 5062, 5054, 4144) of Rigshospitalet
Exclusion Criteria:
- no up-dated weight is listed
- > 5 years old
